page.title: 16CROUGHTON PARISH COUNCIL 2
page.content: A grant is given to the Village Club annually. Negotiations are in hand to purchase a piece of land in Portway to provide a play area for children on that estate. All planning applications are sent to the Parish Council by SNDC for comment, although no regard need be taken of such comment by the authority. A bus is provided for pensioners every fortnight alternately to Banbury and Bicester. The penny rate (a record 4p at the moment to pay for the pavilion) is greatly enhanced by the population at RAF Croughton, and raises about Â£1500 at present. The Parish Council employs a clerk, a cemetery caretaker, and a pensioner to clean the bus shelter and children's playground.
